sub_title: Associate Professor at the International Institute of Social Studies, Erasmus University Rotterdam
summary:
I teach law, human rights and development and conduct research in legal mobilization as a tenured faculty member at the International Institute of Social Studies, in the Hague, The Netherlands, which forms part of Erasmus University Rotterdam. During the 2020-21 Academic Year (specifically, from February - June 2021), I was a Senior Fellow at the Netherlands Institute for Advanced Studies (NIAS) in Amsterdam, funded by the Royal Dutch Academy of Sciences (KNAW), where I led a Theme Group on Legal Mobilization: Analyzing Law-Based Advocacy. I currently support a Legal Mobilization Platform that involves a wide consortium of scholars and practitioners; see www.iss.nl/LMP

My long-time association with South Africa (and Southern Africa) is maintained through my position as a senior research fellow in the Faculty of Law at the University of the Witwatersrand in Johannesburg, South Africa and as an Editor (formerly Editor-in-Chief) of the South African Journal on Human Rights. My research explores the potential of law to support progressive, rights-based structural change in a variety of contexts and themes. I hold various ancillary positions, including the Advisory Board of the Public Interest Litigation Project (Amsterdam) and International Lawyers (Geneva). I engage with the media and have given many public lectures in Europe, South Africa and elsewhere in the world.

In 2017 I was a visiting guest researcher in the Sociology Department at Princeton University.
